snippet: ORLEY ASHENFELTER, the Princeton University economist who regularly upsets the wine establishment with his unorthodox approach to judging vintages, has completed a new classification of California cabernet sauvignons.         His method is similar...
lead_paragraph: ORLEY ASHENFELTER, the Princeton University economist who regularly upsets the wine establishment with his unorthodox approach to judging vintages, has completed a new classification of California cabernet sauvignons. His method is similar to the most famous of all wine rankings, the 1855 classification of the wines of Bordeaux: it is based not on tasting and sniffing, the traditional tools of wine experts, but on the prices of mature wines at auction.
